channel.title: Listening to your tracks on Auxy
channel.description:
last month i recal that you could listen to your tracks on Auxy and it will still play through when you turn your phone off. ever since , possibly from an update, the music stops playing when you turn your phone off. if this was a glitch on my phone for a while then got fixed, it wasnt something that should have been fixed. @Auxy can yo make it so we can listen to our tracks while our phones are off? this is good for when i am walking between classes and i can listen to my track i am working on so i can critique it with out my leg touching the screen when in my pocket and to save battery.
anyone ever remember this happening about a month ago?

item.title: Listening to your tracks on Auxy
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I like @Cheddr‚Äôs thoughts on using SoundCloud, especially about being able to use comments to make notes about possible changes, etc‚Ä¶
Good idea.

I personally dump mine into a specific playlist in Spotify, via the support for local files. (Done via laptop, but syncs and download automatically with my iPhone/iPad (while you‚Äôre still on the same network as the laptop.)

It means I have my own music and everything else in the music player app that I use most often.

Read full topic
item.source: Listening to your tracks on Auxy

item.title: Listening to your tracks on Auxy
item.dc:creator: W7SEGUY
item.description:
Thanks @Auxy. Checked the article and the free apps it mentions (not willing to pay for apps just to try them). But I don‚Äôt think they will help me out.
I like to keep things in one place, which is Auxy and I have lots of space (iPhone 7, 128GB) so I keep all my rendered projects there to listen. It‚Äôs just too much work if you have to export everything and load them back in another music player.
(If Apple would only allow us to put music directly into the music app instead of connecting to iTunes.)

Anyways, would it be possible then to lock the screen while playing the renders? That would help out alot‚Ä¶

Read full topic
item.source: Listening to your tracks on Auxy

item.title: Listening to your tracks on Auxy
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
Perhaps try one of these and let us know if it works well?

iMore ‚Äì 19 Oct 17

Best third-party music player apps for iPhone

Hate the iOS Music app or just want something different? Check out these great third-party apps!

item.title: Listening to your tracks on Auxy
item.dc:creator: W7SEGUY
item.description:
When I‚Äôm not working on my projects, I listen to all my renders and I would LOVE it to be more like a music player! I thought about it many times and wished for it to have a continuous play and shuffle option. I‚Äôm sure lots of other users would appreciate these added functionalities. I understand if it‚Äôs not a high priority though.

Read full topic
item.source: Listening to your tracks on Auxy

item.title: Listening to your tracks on Auxy
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
It‚Äôs possible, but that would mean we spend time building a music player, which is already available in other apps instead of working on other features that everyone wants.

Read full topic
item.source: Listening to your tracks on Auxy

IDK, I don‚Äôt really get Ableton links. I was using it once while playing some game at my friend‚Äôs house, and he also has auxy, and all of a sudden his phone linked to the song, it was really weird so‚Ä¶ yeah i don‚Äôt know.

item.title: Listening to your tracks on Auxy
item.dc:creator: Cheddr
item.description:
I do this all the time (listening to what I‚Äôm working on while walking or driving). But, man, Auxy drains the battery like this! So I started posting things in progress to SoundCloud as a private track to save juice. Added benefit, if you can get back to your computer you can use SoundCloud comments to record what you want to edit with time stamps.

Read full topic
item.source: Listening to your tracks on Auxy

item.title: Listening to your tracks on Auxy
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
No good to use it in this way. Better to drop your renders into e.g. the Files app or some music player app that you can use to listen while the phone is locked.

Read full topic
